content:
Post an image of the code you currently have in the 'userChrome.css' file.

I'm using the following which works ok for week, multi-week and month even when I expand window to maximise. It will be similar to what you see on a 'day' setting, but that depends upon the width of window. For the window size I use, it never appears even in day setting. It depends upon the min-width - I've got 1000px. 


/* CALENDAR  - set event colour instead of calendar colour */  .calendar-category-box{     margin:0 0 0 -200px !important;     min-width: 1000px !important;     }     .alarm-icons-box,.reminder-icon{     margin:0 0 0 0!important;     }     .event-name-label,.item-time-label,.alarm-icons-box,.reminder-icon{     z-index:100000!important;     }      .calendar-item-flex{     padding:0!important;     }      .calendar-month-day-box-list-item{     margin:0!important;     }      .calendar-color-box{     border:none!important;     }       .event-name-label{     white-space:break-spaces !important;     }

content:
Many thanks for getting back to me. I really appreciate it. Please see below what was in my .css file in Chrome. I note that the only difference is the min-width: 200px (yours 1000px)

/* Calendar - set event category colour instead of calendar colour */

.calendar-category-box{ margin:0 0 0 -200px !important; min-width: 200px !important; } .alarm-icons-box,.reminder-icon{ margin:0 0 0 0!important; } .event-name-label,.item-time-label,.alarm-icons-box,.reminder-icon{ z-index:100000!important; } .calendar-item-flex{ padding:0!important; } .calendar-month-day-box-list-item{ margin:0!important; } .calendar-color-box{ border:none!important; } .event-name-label{ white-space:break-spaces !important; }

content: if the accounts are Gmail or Outlook, those save to the Sent folder by default. That is, from my experience, even if you set thunderbird to save the sent message elsewhere, a copy still goes to the Sent folder.
creator: davidsk

content:
david is quite correct. Many servers now auto save sent mail in the server 'Sent Mail' folder.

As a heads up: If you right click on an email and select ' Open' > 'Open message in Conversation' It will open in a new tab and contain all messages within that thread including any responses you made even if they have stored in the 'Sent' folder. So you can see the entire conversation in context.

It means you do not have to save sent emails in the Inbox in order to see the conversation in context. It also means the Inbox mbox file does not become so large. After all, the mbox file is just a single text file with emails appended to it as an when they get downloaded. You significantly increase the risk of potential major loss etc if you keep a lot of emails in just a single text file.

The 'Open message in conversation' applies to any email no matter what folder it's stored in.

This is a rather a good way of viewing a particular conversation as it removes all the clutter of other threads and you can leave it open in case you need to go back and refer to it.
creator: Toad-Hall

Se non spieghi esattamente che problema incontri, non ti si pu√≤ rispondere... Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content: The instructions to reset primary password are different, depending on your release of Thunderbird. This URL has the specifics: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_reset-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it
creator: davidsk

content:
Please be more specific in what you did. I presume you have thunderbird and profile on old computer, and you're setting up a new computer? If that is the situation, here are my suggested steps:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: A simple way is to locate profiles.ini at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird and edit it to have name you want. That is where thunderbird looks to know what profile to use. Another way is to start thunderbird, click tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation, and at next screen, click to import profile.

content:
First, check that you installed from thunderbird.net, and not from Microsoft. The executable should be in c:\program files . Assuming you installed from thunderbird.net, you can locate the active profile this way: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - there you are. note the folder location and folder name. You are in Windows File Explorer inside the profile. - at this point, exit thunderbird - back up one folder so that you are in the Profiles folder. One of the folders in that folder is your copied profile. Since you know the name of the copied profile, you can proceed with some simple file copies. Here are steps: - click to the imported profile - for local folders, open the Mail folder and then the Local Folders folder. All the foldes will appear as foldername, foldername.msf. Ignore the msf entries as those are indexes that will be automatically recreated. Copy the files to the active profile into the same location - Mail\Local Folders - copying POP accounts are a bit more involved, so I'll wait to hear whether you have any.

IF you did NOT find thunderbird.exe in a folder in c:\program files, then we need to start there. Let me know

content:
√à un problema che di solito si presenta solo con la PEC. In sostanza ti basta andare in rubrica, trovare il contatto che appare sempre come mittente, segnarti i suoi dati per sicurezza e poi eliminarlo.

La spiegazione dettagliata √® questa

La PEC nel sistema italiano √® una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST √® mediata dal una societ√† abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici [1] (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremi quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST. Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato √® che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di". Per risolvere il problema √® necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Mittente+sbagliato+nelle+PEC.-

content:
I'm assuming you are wanting to create a new 'Address Book':

Open 'Address Book' using one of the following methods:

  • In left 'Spaces Toolbar' click on the 'Address Book' icon
  • OR via 'Menu Bar' Toolbar - 'Tools' > 'Address Book'
  • OR use keyboard 'Ctrl+Shift+B'

In 'Address Book' Top left pane where it says '+ New Contact' blue button icon on the left - if you hover over it the tooltip says 'Create a new address book'

  • click on the left address book + icon to see drop down list -
  • Select 'new address book'
  • You will be prompted to enter a name for the new address book and then click on 'OK'

OR get a direct link to creating a new address book directly from the 'Menu app icon'

  • 'Menu app icon' (3 lines) > 'New Account' > 'New Address Book' > 'Local Address Book'
  • You will be prompted to enter a name for the new address book and then click on 'OK'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Additional info

If desired you can add 'Address Book' to the 'Mail' tab on the 'Unified Toolbar' so a quick method of opening Address Book although the 'Spaces Toolbar' does provide it already.

If desired you can also add a 'New Address Book' icon to the 'Unified Toolbar' when viewed whilst in the 'Address Book'. Open 'Address Book', then right click on the 'Unified Toolbar' at the top and select 'Customise' It should auto select the 'Address Book' tab 'Drag' the 'New Address Book' onto the Unified Toolbar to the left side You can choose the 'Button Style' , so maybe you prefer 'Icons beside text' - this will be a helpful hint on what the icon actually does. Then click on the bottom right 'Save' button.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
In 'Addons & Themes' what theme are you using ?

'Light' theme should auto use Black text on White background.

If using 'Dark' theme confirm you have the following - post an image of it as it helps.

  • In Settings > General
  • Scroll down to 'Language & Appearance'
  • Click on 'Colours'
  • Set Text to Black'
  • Set Background to White
  • DO NOT select this 'Use System colours'
  • Override the colours....set to 'Never'
  • click on 'OK'


Are you using a Windows OS ?

content:
Hi Dennis. The "Start Page" provides information on a variety of subjects, and can't know whether you donated. And thank you for your donation.

This start page should in no way prevent you from getting to email. But you must click on a folder and then in the message list click on a message to see it. Does that not happen?

Please see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova for a description of the different parts of the screen.
creator: wsmwk

content: That is a signal that the two are not equally set up. To resolve that, you need to investigate the two setups. Both need to be IMAP. You can do some detective work by logging on to your online account and send messages to yourself. Then, shut thunderbird off. Now, send a message to yourself and check if it's received on phone and whether it still shows online. If not, the phone appears to be POP and changing that will fix the issue. If the messages are still there, start thunderbird and see if it retrieves messages (although you can readily check that by clicking settings>account settings. Anyway, doing steps like that should help you resolve the disparity in setups.
creator: davidsk

content: WHat is your version # ?
creator: wsmwk

content: Try this: incoming server: imap.aol.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, normal password outgoing server: smtp.aol.com, port 587, STARTTTL, normal password
creator: davidsk

content:
AOL are using 'OAuth2' authentication instead of 'normal password'. This goes for both, the incoming, and outgoing server.

Also, for the outgoing server, this should be STARTTLS, not STARTTTL.
creator: christ1

content: Thanks, Christ1. It's puzzling, as my account works with normal password. Yes, that was my typo; it should have stated STARTTLS. :)
creator: davidsk

content: AOL allows 'normal password' authentication on apps that don't support OAuth2, like the gmail Android app or W11 Outlook, but the password must be an 'app password'. TB, of course, supports OAuth2 for AOL, the preferred method.
creator: sfhowes

content: Check 'Run search on server'.
creator: sfhowes

content:
1. That's impossibly slow
  2. It makes no difference anyway.

Also I've just noticed that if I run the search on the entire email account then "Body" does appear in the list of options (regardless of whether Run search on server is checked or not) - but if I try to search any individual folder, then "Body" doesn't appear in the list of options (regardless of whether Run search on server is checked or not). But it did until very recently So what's changed?
creator: Dave_Rado

content: On my setup, TB 128 or 140, W11, the Body filter appears only when 'Run search on server' is enabled, both for the account or a folder. In my case, message bodies are not downloaded, but the search on server is fast for a folder with 2,000 messages. Not knowing the state of your profile or the software environment, I can't say why your results are different.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Server searches are FAR slower than local searches. If your bodies aren't downloaded then of course the Body filter won't be available on your setup.

But my bodies ARE downloaded and yet my Body filter isn't available, except if I search all folders, which is also incredibly slow. But my Body filter was available when searching an individual folder until a few days ago.

So please could someone else step in who is able to help me?

Dave
creator: Dave_Rado

content: Could you possibly do a screenshot of what you see? I cannot duplicate that.
creator: davidsk

content:
I've got to the bottom of it.

Even though 'Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer' was checked in the Synchronisation and Storage section of Tools/Account Settings, if I clicked on the Advanced button, a lot of the folders were not checked. Yet the bodies of the emails in those folders had been downloaded. Goodness knows how they could recently have unchecked themselves when they had clearly been checked until quite recently - I would never have knowingly unchecked them.

Very frustrating but at least I know where to look if it ever happens again.

Dave
creator: Dave_Rado
